title: FATAL PLUNGES
features: FATAL PLUNGES is packed with mystery, adventure, and romance from start to finish. Pat, an Irish boy who grew up in a Manhattan orphanage, had frequent nightmares of tumbling from a cliff toward the ocean in a fatal plunge. He ran away at the age of sixteen, joined the military, and fought in WWI. After the war, he went to Ireland to search for his ancestry.One day he stumbled upon the ruins of a castle previously owned by his father, who died in a fatal plunge decades earlier. An elderly man who lived in the ruins revealed his heritage. He also met Shay, the woman who would later become his wife. He eventually was involved in the fatal plunge of the man who caused his father’s fatal plunge decades earlier.Pat and Shay had two sons and two daughters. One day Pat visited the orphanage where he was raised and discovered a son he never knew about, and brought him home.The castle was attacked by remnants of the local militia Pat dismantled years earlier. Pat and Shay’s three sons endured multiple misadventures while growing up, including a kidnapping and discovery of sacks of stolen money in cave at the bottom of a seaside cliff.The three sons all became fighter pilots and all were downed over France during WWII. Pat managed to rescue one son, and the other two overcame almost insurmountable obstacles to return home.Pat and Shay’s sons each endured trials and tribulations in their romantic endeavors. Will a peaceful existence ever be attained?
description: Donald E. Pearse Sr. did not complete his first novel, "FATAL PLUNGES", until after he became an octogenarian. He served in the U.S. Army in Germany, after which he attended a local university for eight years while working full-time in a steel foundry for five years, and later as a testing engineer for an electrical and pneumatic panel manufacturer. He graduated with a BEEE degree and joined a major communications manufacturing firm. While there he obtained a MA degree, and wrote numerous detailed manufacturing instructions. He also created and wrote major sections of a direly needed, very detailed new procedural instruction manual for introducing design changes for use by multiple design organizations, along with manufacturing, and field installation groups. He retired as a Technical Manager with over 30 years of service. He did not begin formal writing until he attended Creative Writing sessions at a local Senior Center. Since then, he has had numerous articles and photographs published. However, he did not begin writing a novel until Joan, his Creative Writing instructor, who years later became his wife, challenged him to create a fictional character. As he wrote about an Irish orphan boy, he morphed into his character, and that homework assignment grew into this exciting novel entitled, "FATAL PLUNGES" He enjoyed writing "FATAL PLUNGES" so much, he began working on a second novel, entitled "A GRAVESIDE PROMISE", which is scheduled for publication shortly after "FATAL PLUNGES" is released. It is an exciting story about romances, mysteries, and adventures deep within a South American jungle. He is currently contemplating a compilation of short stories he has written, and possibly a sci-fi novel. God for has indeed blessed him with the inspiration and talent to write these novels.
